title: ajc needs -d option while correctly compiling classes from subpackage
OB: A directory named 'subpackage' is created under the existing 'subpackage' directory when compiling the class with ajc.
EB: However, the expected behavior is that the compiled class should be placed in the 'subpackage' directory without creating an additional 'subpackage' directory.
SR: To fix this behavior, ajc should be updated to include the '-d' option when compiling classes from a subpackage.
